thread.title: 'Thor: Ragnarok' Behind-The-Scene Photos Highlight New Aliens
thread.title_full: 'Thor: Ragnarok' Behind-The-Scene Photos Highlight New Aliens

author: Adam Barnhardt
title: 'Thor: Ragnarok' Behind-The-Scene Photos Highlight New Aliens
text:
'Thor: Ragnarok' Behind-The-Scene Photos Highlight New Aliens Adam Barnhardt Back to Article Image of 
With the release of Doctor Strange on digital HD today, we’ve been treated to a slew of extra features including the traditional blooper reel and a handful of deleted scenes. We were also treated a feature showing what the folks at Marvel Studios have up their sleeves as the Marvel Cinematic Universe progresses through Phase 3. 
In the feature, we saw several behind the scenes stills from the set of Thor: Ragnarok and judging for the stills alone, the third solo film featuring the Asgardian demigod is going to be different than any movie we’ve seen before. (Photo: Marvel Entertainment) 
We know the Thor Odinson has managed to get imprisoned somewhere on the opposite side of the universe on his quest to find out all he can about the Infinity Stones the MCU has revolved around. We also know that he’ll have to battle the Hulk in a Planet Hulk-like gladiator battle. 
But as MCU Exchange pointed out, the aliens we see in the behind the scenes shot seem to come from a place beyond the Nine Realms. Asgard is based around Norse mythology so it vastly resembles a Vikings-based culture rather than that of a tradition alien culture. 
The otherworldly-beings we see resemble those that we’d see in a Star Wars movie or better yet, residents on a planet that a certain Guardians of the Galaxy group would visit. (Photo: Marvel Entertainment) 
What do you think? After they fight, where do you think Thor and the Hulk will stop in their jouorney around the galaxy as they work to stop Hela, the Asgardians god of Death, from destroying the universe? As these behind the scenes photos continue to surface, we’ll assemble them in the gallery below. 
In Thor: Ragnarok , Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is imprisoned on the other side of the universe without his mighty hammer and finds himself in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok – the destruction of his homeworld and the end of Asgardian civilization – at the hands of an all-powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela (Cate Blanchett). But first he must survive a deadly gladatorial contest that pits him against his former ally and fellow Avenger – The Incredible Hulk!” 
MORE THOR: Hulk vs Thor Concept Art / Concept Art of Cate Blanchett's Hela / Thor Ragnarok: Who Is Hela? / 5 Planet Hulk Easter Eggs We Need in Ragn arok 
Thor: Ragnarok , the third installment of Marvel’s popular Norse Super Hero, is directed by filmmaker Taika Waititi. Kevin Feige will produce the film, joined by executive producers Louis D’Esposito, Brad Winderbaum, Victoria Alonso, Thomas M. Hammel and Stan Lee. 
Thor: Ragnarok will be released on November 3, 2017. Are you excited for Thor 's next solo adventure? Let us know by rating your anticipation for the movie, below!
